XREquirectLayer.summary: NOTE Experimental The XREquirectLayer interface of the WebXR Device API is a layer that maps equirectangular coded data onto the inside of a sphere.

remarks.para: XREquirectLayer requires the layers feature to be enabled for the . You can request it in .
To create a new XREquirectLayer, call either:
To present layers to the XR device, add them to the layers render state using .

XREquirectLayerCentralHorizontalAngle.summary: NOTE Experimental The centralHorizontalAngle property of the interface represents the central horizontal angle in radians for the sphere.
XREquirectLayerCentralHorizontalAngle.value: A number representing the central horizontal angle in radians for the sphere. Setting centralHorizontalAngle to a value less than 0 will set it to 0 and setting it to a value higher than 2π will set it to 2π.

XREquirectLayerLowerVerticalAngle.summary: NOTE Experimental The lowerVerticalAngle property of the interface represents the lower vertical angle in radians for the sphere.
XREquirectLayerLowerVerticalAngle.value: A number representing the lower vertical angle in radians for the sphere. Setting lowerVerticalAngle to a value less than -π/2 will set it to -π/2 and setting it to a value higher than π/2 will set it to π/2.

XREquirectLayerRadius.summary: NOTE Experimental The radius property of the interface represents the radius of the sphere.
XREquirectLayerRadius.value: A number representing the non-negative radius (in meters) of the sphere. Values of zero or infinity are treated as representing an infinite sphere. Setting radius to a value less than 0 will set it to 0.

XREquirectLayerRedraw.summary: NOTE Experimental The redraw event is sent to the XREquirectLayer object when the underlying resources of the layer are lost or when the XR Compositor can no longer reproject the layer. If this event is sent, authors should redraw the content of the layer in the next XR animation frame.

remarks.para: See also the property which is also available to XREquirectLayer objects through inheritance from .

XREquirectLayerSpace.summary: NOTE Experimental The space property of the interface represents the layer's spatial relationship with the user's physical environment.

XREquirectLayerTransform.summary: NOTE Experimental The transform property of the interface represents the offset and orientation relative to the layer's .

XREquirectLayerUpperVerticalAngle.summary: NOTE Experimental The upperVerticalAngle property of the interface represents the upper vertical angle in radians for the sphere.
XREquirectLayerUpperVerticalAngle.value: A number representing the upper vertical angle in radians for the sphere. Setting upperVerticalAngle to a value less than -π/2 will set it to -π/2 and setting it to a value higher than π/2 will set it to π/2.
